results.title: A Malecite fancy basket: national Indian arts and crafts
results.creator_credit: Geoff Noyce and B T Film Sound
results.brief_description: Veronica and Jim Atwin, Malecite Indians from the Kingsclear reserve, have been making functional baskets for many years. The film shows how they select and prepare the materials and then make a beautiful fancy basket from black ash and sweetgrass.
results.title_for_label: A Malecite fancy basket: national Indian arts and crafts

results.title: A Life Worth Living
results.brief_description: Presents hypothetical case studies of newly born severely handicapped children. A panel of eminent members of the medical and legal professions are asked what their decisions would be in these situations when one human being has the power of life and death over another

results.title: A life in your hands
results.creator_credit: Robert Littlewood and Safe Work Video
results.brief_description: Produced in collaboration with the Ambulance Service, this dramatised first aid video details the steps involved in Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (or CPR). A work team operating in a remote area respond to the apparent electrocution of a work mate. No pulse, no breathing. Initially shocked by the event, the workers must remond themselves of the steps involved in both raising the alarm and reviving their workmate. Intended as a reminder of the steps involved in CPR, this video can be used to highlight the importance of the use of CPR in an emergency situation.

results.title: A Letter to Dad: a Story of Co-Dependency
results.brief_description: This program examines co-dependency. Reluctantly, Megan attends her uncle’s funeral, and in the company of her two cousins, revisits her childhood home. Witnessing Megan’s distress, her cousin encourages her to speak of the effects of her father’s alcoholism on her childhood. This conversation leads Megan to seek a therapist’s help, and during these sessions she realises the important role her past unhappy childhood has had in determining her life. She is eventually able to lay to rest all the anger, grief and guilt that she has been carrying for so long.

results.title: A Land lived in
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper, Campbell Harper Films and National Trust for Scotland
results.brief_description: The work of the National Trust for Scotland. By restoring and protecting the properties and estates which have been placed under its care, the Trust helps to preserve the great historical and artistic landmarks of Scotland. The film brings out the historical associations of famous places, with a background of Scottish folk song.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Harper, Campbell Harper Films and National Trust for Scotland

results.title: A is for atom
results.creator_credit: General Electric and John Sutherland Productions
results.brief_description: Explains by animation the nature of a single atom and its nucleus, the way in which atoms differ from one another, and the significance of the terms radioactive and stable. Describes the experiments which led to nuclear fission, the separation of mass uranium for the first atomic bomb, and the mass production of the artificial element plutonium. Explains the functioning of an atomic pile and the peace-time uses of atomic energy in agriculture, industry, transportation and medicine.

results.title: A Hole in one
results.brief_description: An early animated film about a farmer and his attempts to ride his pet goat. Efforts by the local policeman to ride the goat also fail. The goat finally charges at the farmer and butts him head first into the 18th hole, hence the title of the film

results.title: A Gift to grow on
results.creator_credit: George Zabriskie and U.S. Committee for UNICEF
results.brief_description: The United Nations Children’s Fund. US committee for UNICEF gets ready for its biggest workload. This documentary explains to young children exactly where this money goes. Its example: a poor town in Mexico where UNICEF provides medical help, education and entertainment.
